author: magpiepy94
title: Thank you to the staff
body:
Firstly, I would just like to thank the receptionists and secretaries, despite being so busy day after day, they always remain polite and always willing to help. It has been very busy for all staff including doctors, but in my opinion, the front house staff do not get enough thanks and praise. so THANK YOU very much the service would not work without you all.  
Secondly, the nurses and phelmos are wonderful, so kind and caring, all bring their own personality and humour, making life seem less serious. Thank you, ladies.  
Thirdly, thank you to the GPs who have worked and trained so hard to look after the community in which they work. Pre covid the doctors have been exceptional - offering me time to talk about my problems, even when they are busy and the next patient is waiting. So Thank you - (please can you reintroduce face to face appointments)?  
Thank you Elmswood Surgery. Pat each other on the back.

title: Left feeling abused, worthless and  traumatised
body:
I too have had a very bad experience with this Trust. My experience has been a  distressing one from start to finish. It has left me feeling abused, worthless and  traumatised. 

I self referred myself for having had occasional depression  in my life. After waiting 6 months with no response when I contacted them they told me they were too busy with other patients and to wait longer. Eventually after nearly 12 months  I saw a nurse and several months later still this led to weekly out patient therapy. However, i never saw a psychiatrist or anyone senior, I  was not assessed, and there was no monitoring or review of my progress.  I never had a care plan either. I struggled to deal with some issues that were brought up in my therapy  that were dealt with insensitively and judgmentally. When i tried to say something i was shouted down and accused me of being out of touch and in denial. Sessions kept being cancelled at the last minute and kept changing place which left me anxious and confused. Eventually it got to the point where it was doing me far more harm than good and I asked to see someone else. However they  discharged me when they knew I was feeling suicidal. When both myself and my partner tried to find alternative help for me and I was in crisis at this point they simply referred me back to the trust who had discharged me but they didn‚Äôt respond . They asked why doesn‚Äôt my partner look after me?  My partner raised a concern on my behalf about their bad service, lack of safeguarding, no risk assessment, no  crisis help and their lack of  compassion. Basically his complaint was about their whole flawed system and attitude. The response of the Trust was dismissive - they didn‚Äôt respond to him, refused to meet him and then said it was all my fault.  

Any patient who raises a complaint with this Trust is dismissed as mentally unwell, and we are stereotyped with all kinds of humiliating  labels in order for the trust to place the blame on us for their appalling services. Al  in all, it  has all been a very horrible time for both me and my partner and I wish I had never self referred to them in the first place.

author: Plj123!
title: Carmarthen gets it right
body:
A BREAK THROUGH !  
in a and e first time ever Doctor then a staff nurse has taken addison's more seriously and primary to the injury !  
Well done Glangwily Hospital Carmarthen  
CONGRATULATIONS and it was this a and e consultant that first suggested addison's as my diagnosis . Thanks to this department some drs are still (or getting) "on the ball at last .üè≠üíú

author: A Husband
title: My wife's current experience in Barrington Ward
body: She is being kept (I. e. cared for) in a large and modern single room with no entertainment at all except occasional vehicles passing on the hospital access road outside the window. There is no provision for TV or radio, nor are there any books or magazines. Staff occasionally hurry past the internal window onto the corridor, visible only as blurred shapes intent on their duties. The comparison with a prison cell is irresistible, I fear. She is very patient and uncomplaining, realising she needs to be there until her breathing is better, but asked me about every half-hour, "When can I go home? " All I could say was, "When you don't  need oxygen, and I'll come again tomorrow, with a portable radio and some gardening magazines" - which sounded a little inadequate. I must find out how to make a proper complaint.

author: Niypp55
title: Hip  Operation / that did NOT  happen .
body:
20th I January 2020 an ex- ray showed a full hip operation was required ,I was put on a waiting list and advised of a 6 MONTHS waiting list.  
After 11 MONTHS assessments and tests were made, a date of 5th January 2021 was given for 1st operation . ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî Cancelled. !!!2nd February 2021 date for 2nd operation given‚Äî‚Äîcancelled 5th March 2021 3rd date for Operation ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äîcancelled31st March 2021 4th date given for operation‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-cancelledI need to know when this hip operation is going to take place .MY Story is NOT a Good one and,I do not feel good about it. I feel let down by the NHS . All my cancelled operation were due to be undertaken at Dr Gray‚Äôs Hospital ElginOn one occasion I was told ‚Äî lack of beds was the reason for the delay .On the third occasion I was in the ward with two ladies who were waiting for knee replacements, ready to be gowned up when the surgeon arrived . All operations were cancelled due to emergencies we were given breakfast and sent home .

author: Daisydo1
title: My mum has vascular dementia and severe arthritis
body:
Mum had a fall. Care call sprang into action and paramedics arrived. They where great in assessing mum and getting her back into her chair. They also referred her to your service. However STARS called in and landed at mums front door without contacting myself who has power of attorney. I only know you called because I found a booklet you left and slip of paper regarding feed back. Mums dementia is so bad she can no longer read or remember that you called never mind what was said. Following her latest fall I have arranged with district nurse to supply wheeled commode discussed situation with her carers and social worker. Following discussions with social worker, doctor, district nurse and family we are investigating possible care home for mum. What you have achieved is to confuse mum in a having a stranger enter her home and given me yet another situation to deal with  
As mums power of attorney do not contact mum again. There is nothing else you can offer that we havn't already investigated/ are doing. Stars where involved some years ago following discharge from hospital following investigations. We found service from Stars was a shambles then and would appear has not improved. District nurse and care call both contact myself as mums main carer and they have always given mum and myself every consideration and respect. I cannot say same about Stars  
You asked for honest feedback. One phone call to myself would have saved your time and mine.

author: RAnon
title: Feel very cross about lack of access to doctors appointments
body:
Why is it that whenever I call the surgery I can't get an appointment to even speak to a doctor?  
Three days now I have called, either to be left waiting for so long I had to hang up or be told I can't get an appointment and should call back the next day. Surely with all these telephone appointments it should be easier to speak to a doctor, not harder.  
As well as the concern with my health I am left feeling that the Surgery don't really care about taking to me. Only fulfilling some arbitrary target. I can't even talk to the doctor the next day! How hard would that be to make an appointment for the next day?  
I am left feeling very disappointed in the system. It feels like the stress of trying to buy concert tickets or an xbox! I have to dedicate my days to calling and waiting in a massive queue. I won't even mention the mess of a website or appalling e-consult which always ends up with me having to call the surgery.  
All in all, I am left feeling very cross about my experience and utterly powerless to change what is obviously a bad system for the patients.

author: Z001
title: 2nd covid jab
body: Now at 12weeks still waiting for my 2nd jab have phone the covid help line 3 times been told that I will hear something in a week and nothing what's the point of have the vaccination if you can't do the follow up

readBy.name: Office of Alexander Burnett, MSP for Aberdeenshire West

author: qwertyop
title: Didn't get any help from the emergency department
body:
I was seen by a nurse working in Crosshouse Hospital A&E one evening a few days ago. (I'm 31 so don't know why I was taken in there, perhaps it was busier than I thought). The nurse asked what I'd come for and I proceeded to tell her of my symptoms.  
I stated I had horrible health anxiety and that I'd seen 3 doctors and been to the doctors 5 times in the last few weeks, I had 3 different opinions that didn't help at all and kept being sent away and feeling like I was being failed, but that's another story.  
I told the nurse at that moment I felt like I was going to have a stroke as my face was tingling intermittently on a daily basis but was getting worse with weak limbs and she showed zero compassion, zero enthusiasm to help, and cut me off while I was explaining from the beginning all my symptoms hoping to get some facts or helpful answers pertaining to my problems, and said you need to go see your doctor or call 111.  
I'd already said about my doctor as stated above, and 111 told me to see my doctor, so I was going in circles with no closure and suffered badly, mentally, over the last month. So that caused me more and more stress each time I was sent away with no information to provide closure or hope.  
I tried not to go to A&E but when you think you're going to collapse where else do you turn to? Well apparently not A&E, at least not in this nurse's opinion. I felt she looked at me like I was wasting her time. She told me nothing to help me calm down, she told me no potential reasons for my symptoms and within a few minutes of talking I was told she can't do anything for my anxiety or symptoms and I was to see my doc and go home.  
Now for all I knew I could have had a stroke walking home, paranoid again being sent away with no information or help, and felt like it would take a funeral to be taken seriously.

author: Teragram
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Waiting times
body:
My husband was referred to Orthopaedics in 2020 due ongoing issues with his hip. GP referral highly expected the requirement for hip replacement. He waited well over the expected time to have an initia appointmemt with the consultant. Eventually he saw the consultant in Feb to be advised his hip was extremely bad and he was placed on the urgent list for surgery. He was advised at that he would have his surgery within 12 weeks. Some weeks later he received a letter to say that it would be between 48-52 weeks before he would get the operation. This was extremely disappointing and devastating news to say the least, as he has become extremely disabled as a result of the constant and worsening pain, difficulty in mobilising and the increasing need to use aids for walking and daily living activities. His mental health has also taken a battering due to not being able to work, mobilise or undertake any duties within the home and having to rely on me constantly. I wrote to our MSP to to explore the issues of the now very lengthy waiting time and we were subsequently advised that the letter was erroneously sent out to him. He has now received a further appointment in May with another consultant to be informed that his original consultant has now retired and his care has been handed over. He was then sent for further xray (unclear why, as his condition has only worsened from the initial 'extremely bad' status). It would appear that his referral process is now starting from scratch. So to add insult to injury he finds himself in a long waiting list!!!! I cannot express enough how devastating this is as his condition has not only had a huge impact on him but on myself having to manage his mental health issues, frustrations and support him as best I can for an indefinite period of time. My other concern is that the longer he has to wait on his surgery the more compromised his other hip becomes due to his profound limp and shortening of his affected leg, this was identified at the initial consultation. The consultant advised that he would try to rectify this by undertaking some lengthening as part of the hip replacement surgery. I would also like to acknowledge that as a healthcare worker myself, I'm acutely aware of the impact COVID pandemic has had on NHS services and beyond however, I am deeply disappointed that  
more is not being done to address the waiting times for patients whose quality of life has been significantly affected by the protracted waiting times.. I also would like to say that I appreciate that my husband's situation is not a life or death scenario but nonetheless he is suffering deeply.

author: couragedm53
title: Emergency out of hours social workers
body:
Emergency out of hours social workers night time.  
Called them and they answered really quick got someone to call me back. Someone called me back for information.I was very worried about a family situation. Was told to hold on lots of times as the social work had to look after a family member. I was upset, they laughed saying it was the joys of working from home. Not their fault, I get that COVID means different work but I felt I was bothering them and it was not good situation or experience.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Son of the injured
title: Treatment for elderly mother.
body:
On 13th May my elderly mother became suddenly seriously ill at 6pm. She was erupting blood from all orifices. I called 999 and asked for an ambulance. It took a worrying two hours to get to us, and then two came at once - which, as it turned out, was a good thing.  
The ambulance staff were very thorough and professional. They immediately took care of her - we were exhausted after two hours desperately trying to comfort her and control her whilst she was in pain and still erupting from both ends.  
They called ahead to University Hospital Monklands to get them prepared for her admission and a doctor was standing by so she would get immediate care.  
It was around 10pm before they were ready to make the journey to the hospital.  
My mother was taken to A&E then onto Critical Care/ICU.  
I was called by a doctor and told that she needed a blood transfusion and asked me a number of questions.  
My daughter then reminded me that her gran had a laminated card in her purse to be given to doctors if she ever had to be given blood.  
I took this 50 year old card which was barely readable down to the A&E. The receptionist immediately saw the importance of it, asked me to wait, and went to hand it to the doctors who were treating her. She came back and passed on the doctors thanks.  
I then had a few phone calls in the early hours of the morning with doctors broaching the delicate subject of resuscitation should it be necessary.  
She was taken to theatre where she had a scope to try to find out the cause with the view of deciding upon treatment.  
Later I was called again with an explanation of what had been found and that she had settled a little but was being kept in Critical Care/ICU.  
Luckily my mother responded well to the treatment and her condition improved. She spent a few days in Critical Care before being transferred to Ward 10 and eventually onto Ward 7 before being discharged into the care of my partner and I.  
I‚Äôd like to pass on our gratitude to all the doctors, surgeons, nurses, auxiliaries, ambulance teams, and the A&E receptionist who took such wonderful care of her.  
She spent her 90th birthday in hospital - the ward staff arranged a birthday cake for her and some gifts. They, with some assistance from some fellow patients, made every effort to make my mothers 90th birthday a celebration.  
I‚Äôd also like to say that I fully appreciate being allowed in to visit her each day.  
My only criticism is that when she was discharged she was only given enough prescription for a week. With the Bank Holiday We had to endure 1 day without medication.

author: Rw39
title: Self Directed Support - Social Work
body:
My ASN child has had a budget through social work to help them access the community and explore things mainstream children would do , they have had this for 3 years , in this 3 years they have had 3 different social workers, no one from social work has seen my child in 2 years, they have recently changed over to another worker , no handover was given from his previous worker , I feel that my family are more of an inconvenience to the service rather than them being there for support , emails that I send are ignored , questions that I have are ignored and no one seems interested in them or the challenges we face daily. their budget is renewed each year and again this year it hasnt been paid on time , my child relies on this support and the consistency for them is very important to help with their anxiety and challenging behaviours.  
I feel the whole SDS process is very stressful for families , we started the process for the new budget in March 2021 as their last budget was paid at the end of May 2020, we are now past this date and no funds have been paid or any date when new one will be paid, meaning I now have no idea what support my child can have , this is causing extreme anxiety .

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Paulah
title: Ophthalmology
body:
I had been referred to WGH to get my eye checked as there is a lump on the lid. I have previous history of cancer and I am very concerned about it as it is not getting any better. On calling the referral management service to check how long waiting times are I am informed that in addition to the 6 weeks I have waited, I have to expect another 40-50weeks!  
Absolutely ridiculous waiting times! If my concerns are correct regarding my eye, early diagnosis and treatment are vital to recover. What chance do I have if this is how long I have to wait to meet a professional!

author: giraffenz54
title: Covid 2nd vaccine
body:
I booked and attended for my 1st vaccine in May and my 2nd vaccine was booked for July at SSE arena Belfast. I carefully choose the date on a Saturday as this was the best day for me with child care & work arrangements.  
A few days after receiving my 1st vaccine my 2nd was cancelled and I have been given a Monday date 2 weeks earlier. I am not over 50 and not vulnerable.  
I have tried several times to change my appointment back to my original date or choose an alternative Saturday but after several emails I have been told there is no other dates available.  
I now see on BBC news that 2nd dose vaccines appointments being missed are increasing. Is it any wonder when people like me have carefully booked their appointment only to have it cancelled and an alternate date given.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: emcdgd
title: Hospital stay
body: I was admitted to the hospital with a chest infection, penumonia and had developed sepsis. At times I felt that the ward of 6 I was well looked after. At other times the lack of quality of care was very disappointing.

author: Aloysious
title: Attentive and personable
body: I had to be transferred, as a coronary patient, from Forth Valley Royal Hospital to Royal Infirmary of Edinburgh. In the ambulance were David (driver) and I think Jackie (paramedic). They came from the Falkirk unit. Both were highly attentive and personable. Jackie was brilliant when we were in the ambulance, at making sure I was comfortable, not in pain, and generally in monitoring me. She was also willing to chat. In these circumstances, I value someone who will engage in conversation. At the outset, both were very reassuring and I knew I would be in safe hands. I would appreciate it, if my gratitude could be passed on to them.

author: lyrabe58
title: Herpes
body:
I rang up as this had been confirmed by my GP. I got my own medication for this from the store as it was late on a Friday and I found out and was going away on the Monday.  
I wanted some reassurance that it had gone and the staff were very pleasant on the phone. I went for my appointment-they were very informative and taking the time to explain it to me in great detail. I felt very reassured when I left as I had been feeling rubbish for a few weeks about it. Brilliant service and advised me what to do next time

author: Devoted901
title: Compliments to the tremendous podiatry staff
body:
I had my podiatry appointment at the central clinic on Old Irvine Road, and I have to say they have a lovely set up going on there.  
All the NHS places I've been I've found great - I'm American but I've been in the UK for 30 years now and the one thing I've always really raved about is the NHS, its such a brilliant aim and a brilliant system.  
My appointment was with Amanda and Gary. I have diabetes type II , and my left foot is especially bad, I get all kinds of ulcers, some superficial, some less so - I have a lot of problems with it. This Group at the clinic was sensational. The lovely lass, Amanda, had such amazing attention to detail, it was tremendous. They trimmed my nails, trimmed my callouses, gave me tremendous advice, all so tremendously caring - something I see lacking in a lot of places. Its just so nice to into this establishment and get this kind of atmosphere and care.  
I also want to compliment the receptionist Jill, they said her name was, she was quite outstanding in how she helped me. I can't give these staff a big fat raise they deserve (like all the NHS nurses who deserve one), but I can come here and say something nice about them.

author: Robbo55
title: Cataract surgery
body:
Can‚Äôt deny I was apprehensive about going in for surgery for the first time in my life, but from the moment I arrived I felt completely calm and strangely relaxed,I know a lot of that was down to the nursing care and the attention to detail that was given.  
I was also impressed with the professionalism and attention to detail again by the theatre staff with all the checks and counter checks throughout.  
So can I just say a big thank you to the following people for making a potentially traumatic day into almost an ‚Äúenjoyable‚Äù one.  
Nurses Eva, Claire (l think) Wheelchair to the theatre, Stephen. Surgeon Dr Bharat and her assistant  
Thanks again  
Best regards

author: #teamSteele
title: 6 week stay in Ward 9 Coronary Care
body:
My husband was admitted to Hairmyres with endocarditis on 20/4/21 and remained there until 29/5/21. The care he received from the nursing staff, doctors, catering and domestic staff was exemplary. He was very ill for a while and they treated him (and me) with kindness and always with a smile and a sense of humour. This made the stay much more bearable.  
He had to have his teeth removed while in and was transferred to the community dentist and had 13 teeth removed under local anaesthetic. He is absolutely terrified of needles and the dentist but the team of dentists and dental nurses who dealt with him at the health centre and later on in the ward when he was having problems were wonderful too.  
I want to mention Danielle who travelled with him to the dentist and kept me informed and kept his spirits up. Throughout his stay she was fantastic and a pleasure to see when I visited. I also want to mention Skye who was one of his nurses. Skye was there with a smile on her face, keeping us both informed and keeping Billy‚Äôs spirits up. There were many other staff who looked after him and I‚Äôm grateful to each and every one of them.  
Too often we only take the time to complain instead of saying thank you.  
Thank you Ward 9!!  
I also want to thank the staff at the Medical Centre who ensured he was seen and recognised the symptoms and sent him to the hospital. We are very lucky to have GP ‚Äòs like Dr Susan and Dr Michael

author: LisaM1981
title: Covid testing
body: Well organised. Very well signposted. Good service.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Warrickhill
title: Self-swab service
body: I have attended NDDH at Barnstaple twice before for Covid swab tests. I live about an hours drive away so performing the test at home saves time, fuel and is far better for the environment and lessens road traffic. The test was simple to perform and the leaflets were easy to understand. The pack arrived in plenty of time and with several drop off locations it made it very easy. So I hope this can continue for as long as we need to have these tests.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Pebbles21
title: Very Welcoming Fern Centre Wig Service
body: The Fern Centre is a very welcoming and sociable place to come. All the staff are very professional and full of great advice. I had a fantastic experience coming for my wig fitting appointment which went very well. Looking forward to when the centre is fully open again.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Gran of C
title: Virtual drop-in sessions
body: A simple text to the SLT drop-in service resulted in 4 virtual drop-in sessions for my grandson with Speech and Language Therapist Vahri. I am simply amazed at the results! My grandson has a stutter and speech block. Vahri provided a fantastic listening ear, great resources and very successful techniques. My grandson now has a much better understanding of his speech difficulties and is armed with his 'tool box' of techniques to help him. His confidence has soared. Thank you Vahri and the SLT service for providing this care.

readBy.name: North Ayrshire Health & Social Care Partnership
Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

author: SiRaja
title: When my dear wife visited here
body:
After a wait, she was treated very well and was advised with a sustainable care and human touch.  
Well done üëç

author: Klaas
title: Covid vaccination
body: Everybody is doing a great job at the John Scott Health Center. I was in and out and everyone was friendly and organised.

author: SSC70
title: A very good experience
body: I have my first mamogram on the 4th of June at the Breast screening service at Ninewells hospital Dundee. I had a very good experience, from the receptionist making me feel welcomed to the radiographer herself Liz who was very warm and humanized what is a understandably intimate clinical procedure. I am also an AHP as well as this instance being a patient.

author: hawkhk57
title: Same day Covid testing
body: Really good..saves two journeys from Bideford. Lovely helpful staff. Thank you

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Happy service user!
title: Great experience
body: Great experience at John Scott Health Centre. Super efficient process, all of the staff were welcoming and kind, answering any questions I had! Well done all on a great programme.

author: caringqw58
title: Covid test
body:
I was so very nervous as this was my first test. On arrival was met by a pleasant and friendly nurse who explained procedure.
I was dreading it! She gently inserted the swob up each nostril and that was it. No discomfort at all.
I had heard stories of the swob being pushed right up the nostril until pain was felt. I was so relieved this wasnt my experience.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Mrsneverin
title: My diabetes
body: Thanks to the diabetic nurses I have now got my diabetes under control. I had given up, lost heart, so once again thank you.

author: asteropezx87
title: Aural Care
body: Amazing team at Aural Care, thank you ladies.   I have been seen 3-4 times over the last 2 months, they have managed to find me appointments and when I rang the Booking Office to change an appointment I was offered a cancellation 48 hours later - brilliant.   Please keep educating people to cancel appointments and not just turn up.

author: Sutherg56
title: Ultrasound examination
body: First of all I visited my GP, who was excellent and referred me for an urgent Ultrasound Examination. This was arranged very quickly and I had my appointment in early June. I would like to express my thanks to the staff involved in the process, from the X-Ray Reception throught to the Ultrasound Room. I arrived at Hairmyres Hospital at 3.50pm for a 4pm appointment and was met by very efficient and friendly staff at X-Ray Reception. I was then taken to the Ultrasound Room where Dr Forrest and his assistant performed the examination. This was completed by 4.10pm and I was able to leave the hospital by 4.15pm. All in all a very impressive service from the GP practice through to the examination by the Ultrasound Department. Considering what the NHS has had to deal with throughout the Covid 19 Pandemic and the Lockdowns, I would like to say a big thank you to all of the staff concerned with my care. Thank you.

author: Marpm83
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: First class service
body: First class service from first class staff.   I speak and write from my wonderful experience.   My late husband spent the last few weeks of his life in St Luke's Hospice.   I had a bed put in his room so I could sleep over as I knew he was not going to live long.   His care was superb and the staff were beautiful in every way.

author: Hayleyy
title: Friendly and warm service
body: I felt very reassured and comforted. The Doctor and Nurse were so friendly and warm and put me at ease. They were very efficient and attentive which was important as I was a little nervous and they explained everything so clearly. I was looked after very well!

author: footballfan
title: Very impressed
body:
I have been coming to this department since November 2020 due to a referral from my GP. I was diagnosed with MGUS.  
I have been very impressed with this department. I have been seen in clinic and have had 1 telephone appointment. The nurses and doctors have been excellent and explained everything very clearly. When I came to the department for blood to be taken last week, I can honestly say I didn't feel a thing!

author: Zebedee7
title: They do a great job
body: Have visited there for past 23 years. Find all nurses I see very friendly & do a great job, I know them all. Was the mini-pill I was on for the first 3 years but I had to start having the Depo vaccination due to my medication being increased. Have had a break a few times as you cannot continuously have this, but I‚Äôve managed. Found Depo perfect for me.

author: xraydw43
title: I find this service invaluable
body: My mum has been in hospital for a while now. She started in Daisy Hill hospital, she was then moved to Craigavon hospital and then to a care home for rehabilitation. Unfortunately the care home did not work out and she has ended up back in Daisy Hill hospital again.The service that is offered by the Southern area Trust where the family can book a video chat with my mum is amazing. My mum is in her 80's and modern technology is not her friend and she is unable to use it even though my nephew has tried many times to show her how to use it. I live in London and I have recently just finished chemotherapy for lung cancer so this service lets us see each other and more importantly my mum is able to see that I am doing ok. A video chat with my family always cheers my mum up which is the best tonic for her. I find this service invaluable and it would be very disappointing if it was removed. A lot of elderly patients have family all around the world and this service gives them the opportunity to chat with the patient. It's not just during the current covid pandemic that this service is invaluable but for elderly patients at all times.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: karen149
title: Help and support
body: I just want to say a huge thanks for all the help and support that the physiotherapist Joe has given me over the past 12 weeks. I was a little reluctant in the beginning to take part, but after the 1st session I felt completely at ease and looked forward to a Thursday morning. Calling out our names and giving encouragement throughout each session really did make me feel like I was part of a group. It made such a difference when the weather was bad and we were in lockdown. I received the youtube link and I'm determined to keep up the exercise as it also helped to improve my mood. Well again thanks so much Joe and I wish you the very best.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: HappyJ
title: Abdominal surgery
body:
I was a patient in the day surgery/ambulatory ward following abdominal surgery. I would like to thank all staff who cared for me during a 5 day stay but there are a number of nurses and auxiliary staff who really went above and beyond.  
A special thank you to Louise, Katie, Katelyn, Laura, Julie, Linda and first year student Mollie who made me feel safe and kept me well informed every step of the way. I was overwhelmed with the level of kindness and support.  
Ella, Dee and Samantha could not do enough for me, and nothing was ever too much trouble. They kept my spirits high and Ella always provided the laughs.  
Can‚Äôt thank them enough!  
In addition to this, my surgeon, Mr MacDonald, performed miracles. Forth Valley NHS are the best!  
Thanks again.

author: Marpm83
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Reassurance from Palliative helpline
body: Kind, helpful, informative.   Left me feeling cushioned and safe in the knowledge that you are there to help with the care of my husband in the future when I need it.

author: violetbk35
title: A great place to start.
body:
My life had become unmanageable. It was time I got some help.  
STARS was a great place to start, they gave me all the information I needed.

author: eddieC
title: Emergency Admission
body:
In the space of a few hours I went from feeling healthy to experiencing increasingly pain chest pains and difficulties with breathing. I felt very afraid and thought that my 81 years of life was ending,  
I phoned 999 after midnight and the paramedics arrived within half an hours and took me to A&E where I spent several hours being examined in various ways.The staff were very competent and so well organised, reassuring and caring.  
I was sent to Ward 7 quite early in the morning where treatments and further examinations were carried. My pains were due a chest infection and the care of the staff immediately made me feel better and secure. The nurses were friendly, quite informal, positive and encouraging and sociable along with a professional and very caring attitude.  
They looked after me so well that I was able to recover quickly and went home two days later with a supply of medications. Thank you so much ladies. You made me feel so much better and on the road to recovery.

readBy.name: North West Ambulance Service NHS Trust

author: blinnemccabe
title: Paediatric Multidisciplinary Feeding Clinic
body:
In late April, my daughter had been referred to the multidisciplinary feeding clinic at Daisy Hill Hospital for her ongoing issues with reflux and cows milk protein allergy.  
We met with Dr McKibbon at our initial consultation. She listened to my concerns with regards to my daughter and was so sympathetic and thorough in her assessment and prognosis. She totally empathized with my as this was my first experience of reflux and CMPA with my children. She clearly explained the prescribed course of action and all the various professionals who would be liaising with us along the way. I could not fault her disposition, courteousness and general care throughout our meeting.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Angher95
title: My birth experience
body:
As a first time mother, I was so nervous about giving birth throughout my pregnancy. I really thought it was going to be the worst experience of my life! As soon as I got to ward 16, the team put me at ease. They explained everything and were so warm and friendly and couldn‚Äôt do enough to help me and my partner Nick.  
The birth itself was so straightforward and just what I had hoped for. Libby was an absolute angel and we clicked with her immediately. She is a credit to your team. We chatted about all sorts in between contractions and I felt so relaxed. I genuinely don‚Äôt think it would have been as straightforward without her! The birth pool is the best invention ever!  
I‚Äôve came away from the experience with such a buzz and I feel like superwoman. I never thought I‚Äôd feel like this and it‚Äôs all thanks to the wonderful team! I tell everyone how amazing my birth was - a world away from what I was expecting it to be, especially during a global pandemic.  
Every staff member we came into contact with were so lovely, helpful and informative. I can‚Äôt put into words how grateful we both are for everything they did for us. I‚Äôm in total admiration of what they do on a daily basis. They are all superheroes and deserve medals!

author: wearinggd64
title: Support was spot on
body:
Started using crack for 4 years, hid it from family, lost care of the children, I have them back now.  
My key worker was great, the support I got was spot on. I was given all the help and guidance I needed. My life is back on track.

author: a very grateful daughter
title: The excellent treatment I received
body:
I was admitted to the RAH on Tuesday. First to the Surgical assessment unit, then transferred to Ward 20.  
I can't thank the staff enough for their care and attention, it was second to none. To the Surgical Registrar who got me booked in for a CT scan within an hour of seeing me and popped in to see me 3 hours later with the results.  
To the amazing staff in Ward 20, to mention a few the Student nurses Paulina, Lara and Emma and Staff nurses Ryan, Bethany, Elizabeth and Alison. There are many more who's names I forget but thank you to you all.  
Also have to mention the Surgical Doctors and the Gastro team. I appreciate and thank you all for looking after me so well.

author: Jasperdodo
title: Colonoscopy
body: I was under the care of Glen in the endoscopy department alongside his staff - the care I received was second to none absolutely amazing from start to finish - very experienced staff and I felt in capable hands 10/10 thank you so much

author: horologiummz76
title: Infliximab infusion
body:
Brilliant service. Staff very friendly. I feel very comfortable during my stays. Staff professional and personable.  
They could improve if there were more staff working. If the treatments could be run in more hospitals closer to me. Dungannon is great, but I believe this is only temp due to Covid.  
Not too sure if this would be possible but it would be great if infusions were ready to go straight away on arrival.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: vulpeculacj37
title: In for infusion
body:
In South Tyrone Hospital for infusion today  
Experience very good  
Staff very attentive

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: chig1
title: Vaccine
body:
Went to get my vaccine today, was very satisfied with the service provided. The arena was laid out very well, the structure was very easy to follow and social distancing measures were easy to adhere to despite the vast numbers of people being vaccinated. The flow system throughout the arena was remarkable.  
The staff were also very commendable, in that from start to finish, everyone was very helpful, and willing to do so. The staff at the check in and check out were very friendly and made me feel very comfortable. The doctor/nurse that administered my vaccination were very clear and concise about the possible symptoms which I may encounter, as well as other important information. The administration of the vaccine was quite, easy, and done very professionally. The staff at the rest area were also very good, ensuring the chairs were sanitised after each use, they were also very pleasant.  
Overall, I had a very good experience at the SSE Arena for my first dose of the Pfizer vaccine, and I‚Äôm looking forward to getting my second dose.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: sagittanc59
title: Someone to turn to
body:
On first dealing with this team, Doncaster Social Prescribing very relaxed meeting informative, all what was suggested all was fulfill and carried out  
Debbie was always there, someone to turn too, for a chat, very helpful and friendly, was very nervous at first when I thought I was on my own, with my husband problems and didn't know who to turn too or ask advice, felt more relaxed and able to cope when I knew there was help, on the other end of the phone, like to say a big thank you to Doncaster Social Prescribing team, for all the help and advice we were given.

author: redzj66
title: Extremely helpful staff
body: I have never had a bad experience using the service. Staff go over and beyond their duties and are extremely helpful anytime I need help or have any questions

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: zulukt58
title: A great idea
body:
I attended South Tyrone Day Clinical Centre at the beginning of April.  
I found the staff friendly and warm and in turn this helped me stay calm. I was there for an Iron infusion. I was glad when the letter came to confusion the date time and place cause the idea of attending appointment in CAH due to the pandemic and the power of setting clinics outside of the main hospitals of the Southern Hospitals is a great idea and I think going forward these clinics should remain out of CAH at any cost. The staff couldn't do enough for me.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: turkeyqk77
title: Attending WRN
body: After lockdown I attended the wellness recovery network and I felt safe and loved every minute. It was everything and more that I thought it would be.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: jackpottp45
title: Same day testing
body:
Arrived at 7am for a covid test prior to gastro appointment  
Was seen at 7. 01 and test completed within a couple of minutes  
No queue, really quick and simple  
The different swap and procedure made things slightly less unpleasant too  
Altogether a good experience

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: zulust56
title: Very worthwhile visit
body: Visited by Grace. Very professional, thorough and friendly, took her time to explain the full process and made sure I fully understood. Very patient and understanding. Very worthwhile visit, and very much appreciated.

author: Sajila
title: Great patient care in MRI/Radiology outpatients
body: I‚Äôve had long term conditions for over 20yrs. Including a particularly bad experience a few years ago. I was nervous going into this appointment. But Arash, Jim & the administration staff member were so polite and kind. As I was NBM I hadn‚Äôt taken some of my routine meds to help with the pain. Was in agony during the proceedure/scans. Both Arash & Jim were so patient. I really appreciated their calmness and kindness.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: Naun
title: Getting contraception from the clinic
body: Everybody was super friendly, and had my needs at heart, I was offered a variety of different methods and explained the risks, and implications of each of them. Super fast, and very reliable

author: virgoxw43
title: I prefer this location
body: I attend for rheumatology. I feel very safe in these COVID times in Dungannon Hospital. The staff are very good. There is a location that is handier for me but I prefer Dungannon.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: warmqs35
title: COVID-19 testing
body: I had a very easy, no hassle COVID-19 test.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: tabez75
title: COVID-19 VACCINATION
body:
I have had the 2 doses of vaccine. A warm welcome to the area was given to me from staff connected with the building itself, then the nursing staff. It was clear where to go and wait, they were chatty and friendly, put me at ease. Information given was clear and questions asked were appropriate. It was quick but not rushed. I was stressed (for personal reasons) when I arrived, but the experience and the friendly advice...no, not advice, the freedom to say and choose not to do, a minor boost was given to me.  
Thank you to everyone.

author: emmemmcee
title: My Day Surgery experience today
body:
I attended Day Surgery today for a colonoscopy - not a procedure that I relished however the team I met today put me at my ease and made an invasive procedure as dignified as it could be. From the admin staff, nurse Lynn who admitted me and Dr MacDonald, Fiona and Dot the nurses, I owe you a big thank you. It was over so quickly thankfully. I was looked after by nurse Sharon after the procedure and every staff member acted with so much care and compassion, my nerves were allayed. I have had no ill effects.  
Thank you to the entire team.  
One little bit of constructive feedback - . I was given conflicting advice with the bowel prep. The Moviprep leaflet gives conflicting information to the NHS Lanarkshire leaflet by informing the person to have a light lunch the day before whereas the NHS L leaflet advises 24 hours before the person can only have clear fluids - no food. There is a lot to take in pre procedure and I think this confusion should be rectified. I trust this will be looked at.  
Thanks for everything

author: GMoney
title: Covid-19 Vaccination
body: Staff made me feel very comfortable and were very professional. Execution of the vaccination was excellent. Overall a very good experience.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: requirementrw78
title: Getting a covid test
body: Really lovely nurse, easily explained and felt taken care of. Was done in minutes and just had to sit and wait for my results

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Angelica88
title: Having Loop Excision of the cervix
body:
Today I attended an appointment on ward 1b at the pilgrim hospital to have a procedure called (lletz) after getting my biopsy results 3 weeks ago it was decided I needed treatment.  
I was absolutely terrified of going today as I have had this same procedure 7 years ago and I found it an horrendous experience back then so I expected the same this time. But I went along to my appointment today and I could not of been looked after any better and need not of worked myself up at all for this procedure.  
The consultant that did the procedure was Mr Mohanty, he was so informative every step of the way throughout the procedure and he reassured me alot throughout, the procedure itself he was so quick and there was no fuss at all with it and nothing hurt this time! ! I was so relieved and grateful. The two nurses I had in there with me for the procedure Tracey and Anita were fantastic they both totally took my mind off everything that was happening and talked to me the whole time I was in there and reassured me no end.  
The whole experience was probably the best I could of hoped for today considering and I am so very grateful to the health care team I had today at the Pigrim on ward 1b so thank you very much.

author: crocodilehf84
title: Covid vaccine at sse
body: I was extremely nervous about getting the first jab but the staff at the sse were absolutely amazing. Can‚Äôt wait for second jab now haha. Thank you to everyone, what you are doing is amazing! !

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shmoll
title: Visit to Branston Open Clinic
body: Had a full sexual health screening and check. The staff were lovely! Especially blonde nurse with hair in a bun (I think she was called Rachael) really put me at ease and made sure I was comfortable and okay. Dr Mansell explained everything to me really clearly, I knew what was happening and what my next steps are. It was a very positive experience.

author: airhq73
title: They are all very kind
body:
The district nurse from Ballymoney Family Practice calls every Wednesday and manages my pegtube maintenance. They are all very kind and good at what they do.  
They attend my needs and are easy to talk to. They feed back to the doctor if I have any concerns. I am very grateful for this service.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: cricketyg93
title: It helps a lot of people
body:
Firstly I would like to thank the NHS and Inclusion for all the support, and Key Workers for all their help. I think it helps a lot of people, but not all. You can not win them all, its down to the individuals willpower to beat their addiction. I went to Farlington for a Detox for ten days and I met a lot of good people and some of the stories I heard were heartbreaking. In my opinion a lot of people there were helped and hopefully will go on to sort themselves out to get on with their lives. The counsellors and staff were great. At New Milton I found uncomfortable talking in front of a group of strangers about personal problems, some people find it intimidating and are put off from attending. Possible one to one with a Key Worker would suit some people better. Although I know you have limited resources. But overall I think Inclusion helps a lot of people. I would like to thank Jason and Tina who is a rock and deserves a promotion and pay rise immediately. I am not out of the woods yet but I can see the trees.  
Thank you all

author: hydrapp36
title: A very valuable and practical source of help
body:
I was offered CMP as I am a carer of my husband who has autism, an adult daughter lives at home with Autism, another daughter with dyslexia, a son also care for my two elderly parents who live separately. I work part-time until Covid. I wear a hearing aid, due to suffering from Mild hearing loss and severe tinnitus post shingles virus.  
My husband is still on a waiting list for one to one help from NAS for 3 years now after his diagnosis so I feel I needed support of someone to help me.  
I have completed a CMP course with an occupational therapist. That weekly 1 hour contact was exactly what I needed just to offload anxieties and stresses and refocus on the week ahead. She is an excellent source of support. I'm a mental health professional myself and benefitted from this outside, objective support network.  
Together we drew up practical and workable strategies to face the week ahead and prioritise goals and it helped reduced the stress.  
This is a very valuable and practical source of help! and should be offered long term to carers!

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Genyf37
title: Disjointed In-Patient Experience
body:
Admitted Dec 2020, faultless care a&e/emergency care, transfer to ambulatory care unit, unisex toilets/shower filthy, full urine pans left in toilet, some staffs defensive attitude/mantra we are short stay, not liking my reference to bringing to their attention the ward current status.... a long stay therefore staffs ability to adapt, house keeping/infection controls priority.  
Day of my transfer to another hospital, packing up the bed side cabinet which was brought to staffs attention on my admission....did not belong to me!  
Admission May 2021 again faultless care a&e/emergency care, transfer to Ward 6 night shift staff leaving syringe driver‚Äôs alarming, buzzers left for at one point 30 minutes, is this a staffing issue?  
Miss communications handed over to day shift impacted my healthcare not being met.  
Transfer to Medical Short Stay the standard of care was on a par with A&E/Emergency Care.  
Patients who require medication before food has to be addressed, continually asking, not once did I see this need met.  
Room requirements for patients using bi-pap therapy has to be addressed imminently, not officials walking around at 10pm trying to move me after 3/4 nights into stay, very disjointed and certainly not the responsibility of the patient, this reflected on my experience which was positive/ negative.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Farhia
title: My brother
body: Certain staff members give very generic answers when enquiring about my loved one. Two word answers like‚Äô he‚Äôs alright‚Äô or ‚Äòhe‚Äôs fine‚Äô isn‚Äôt sufficient when getting an update from staff, when asked to elaborate there‚Äôs a distinct change in tone which is extremely unpleasant and unprofessional. Information from day staff to night staff completely contradict a large majority of the time. Honestly, I feel as though I'm a burden for enquiring.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

author: Anogn47
title: Inpatient Bronte
body: Staff have helped to treat and support me through a very difficult time. They have supported me and my family. I can not thank them enough

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: earmarkns46
title: Excellent follow up
body:
I had been on a waiting list for Hernia Surgery, but had to be rushed to A/E at Ulster Hosp. for emergency surgery for a strangulated Hernia. The result was not satisfactory and I had further emergency surgery in the same week from which my family was told I may not survive. I had excellent aftercare. The food was very poor and some of the communication was difficult and could have been better.The follow up care was excellent - the carers - particularly Amanda and Lisa gave very good advice and help. The Stoma nursing team at the Ulster Hospital were also excellent, as were the continence team - (Kay and Janice) from the Holyrood Arches Centre.  
Overall I was satisfied with the care I received.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust
Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: camelopardaliswj67
title: A courteous and caring professional
body: In her notes which she completed at my home, Carmel outlines the professional duties which she undertook with great aplomb. However she opts not to include her own very personal input to her job, I'd like to state that Carmel is a very kind, courteous and caring professional to helped greatly in reassuring one who was so disappointed in the predicament he found himself. Dispensing uncomfortable news with a smile and an injection of humour is the sign of someone who is comfortable in their job definition and more importantly in their skin. I feel I was indeed truly fortunate to have met such a compassionate, understanding and experienced professional.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: willow1234
title: Scared of needles
body: I‚Äôm so scared of needles and the doctor and medical student looking after me we‚Äôre so considerate and ensured I was okay. I really appreciated it, especially as we have to come in alone. Thanks so much!

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Smiley24
title: My first covid vaccine
body: I was welcomed by a few different members of staff that were all friendly and helpful. Then 2 women done my vaccine. I think their names were Allison and beth. They were so lovely and friendly and made this experience easy and enjoyable.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: EileenS21
title: Virtual call
body: We had a call and we were extremely satisfied with the service, delighted with the facility that this offers, due to the inability to visit the FaceTime call was the perfect opportunity to see the patient and catch up. I would really like to express my gratitude to Dominic who was extremely helpful, pleasant and accommodating to both us and the patient

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Joyfuljo
title: Covid test prior to treatment
body: A surprisingly easy visit to have a Covid test prior to treatment at NDDH this week. The staff greeted me with a warm smile & the test was quick, painless, and over in less than a minute. A truly superb service from the NHS! We are extremely lucky to have this free service in the UK. Thank you!

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Daisy 10
title: My admission with Covid-19
body:
I was admitted with covid at the end of October, initially to HDU for c-pap then ITU for ventilation. I was in ITU for 5 weeks and another 5 weeks between HDU and the wards. I don't remember much about my stay in ITU other than being very frightened. When I was transferred out into the wards I couldn't do very much for myself, I was catheterised, had a feeding tube and was oxygen dependent. Throughout my stay the staff were exceptional from A&E to critical care and beyond, they saved my life and cared for my family as much as they could. Despite their own challenges from wearing full PPE all day, being short staffed and I'm sure very stressed they all treated me with respect and never allowed these issues to impact on my care. Ward 15 staff from the lovely singing housekeeper to the consultant Dr Harrow could not do enough for me. There were 3 brilliant student nurses who kept me sane and I'm sure will become exceptional staff nurses. Gary and Peter who come by for a chat when they could. Lesley on night shift and Sharon who talked me off a ledge a few times when the enormity of my situation hit home. I can not thank them all enough for their care, professionalism, compassion and just the chat that got me through the day. I am also a nurse and I feel so proud to wear the same uniform as them. A big thank you also to the rehab team especially Marie and Rebecca. The ongoing support has been fantastic from the inspire group to making sure any ongoing issues have been investigated and followed up. I am on my way to recovery it has been slow and frustrating but I couldn't have done it without this amazing team. Thank you all  
.

author: Jackkray6
title: Extremely helpful
body: My mum has just spent 10 days on ward 22 at Arrowe Park. I just want to thank all the staff on ward 22. Mum has had the best of care in her 10 days on your ward. Staff always friendly, cheerful and extremely helpful. Thankyou

readBy.name: Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Natb84
title: 111 excellent patient care
body:
I have had to use 111 for my Foster daughter on a few occasions recently.  
The 1st time she was quickly assessed by a call handler and advised she had to go straight to accident and emergency for ECG. She was then admitted to Singleton for cardiology diagnostics and diagnosed with an irregular heart rhythm and started on betablockers. Now she is waiting review under Morriston cardiology and being monitored by the gp.  
More recently she became unwell with what we thought was oral thrush and vaginal thrush. Having seen the pharmacy and gp for this we were shocked when she developed an awful rash quite widespread along with ulcers.  
The 111 call handler was amazing, she listened to us, allowed me to speak for my daughter as she has severe anxiety and felt quite embarrassed. She found her record by listening to the fact she doesn't use her real name. She put the call straight through to the gp oohs. We received a GP call back within 10 minutes. The GP asked numbers questions and put all the recent symptoms together and diagnosed a very rare syndrome. To make sure he booked her an appointment that night within 2 hours. She was then examined and given steroids and strong anthisamines and told that if it worsens she may need admission.  
What an absolute amazing service from start to finish. The call handler was lovely, genuine and kind. Within 3 hours she was trialed, seen, diagnosed and treated. To finish this off we have used the online ask a health question to find out more about this syndrome and how to manage it. We cannot praise the service and experience enough. Thank you NHS and thank you to the call handler FFion at 111 on the 29th May 2021.

author: justmynose
title: Knowledgeable and friendly staff
body: Thank you to all involved with recent ENT surgery in ARI, Mr Ram and the nursing teams in both ward 210 and Woodend pre-assessment clinic.   All staff were so knowledgeable and friendly.   No question was too small and at all stages I felt I received individualised, personal care.   An overnight stay was required following my surgery and I felt very safe under the care of the the night nurse looking after me.   I hope this post helps relieve any pre-surgery nerves for patients plagued with the polyps! !

author: chamaeleonxt37
title: A very scary week
body: My Dad was brought to ED in Antrim by ambulance from Larne. The care from the team in the ED department was out standing, especially as no one was allowed to accompany him. Through phone calls to and from very patient nurses and doctors, we were kept informed of diagnosis and condition. He unfortunately spent over 24 hours in ED but the care was great. One nurse to highlight in particular was Gorgina who kept my mother calm and kept my Dad following doctors orders. He spent the rest of his 6 day stay in ward A4, who again my Dad could not praise high enough. So thank you to all the staff who helped my Dad through a very scary week.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: serpentvaccineman
title: Top staff
body: Staff were excellent. Friendly and welcoming but also efficient and didn't dilly dally.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Hillcroft
title: Minor Injuries & X-ray
body: A few weeks ago I felt very ill & 111 advised me to go to Abingdon hospital. The nurse there was particularly kind and arranged for me to go on to the John Radcliffe in Oxford. I am so grateful to her. Then today I had an X-ray at Marcham Road and the staff were very friendly & helpful. It‚Äôs so wonderful to have this local hospital. Thank you for being there.

author: waterloo
title: Outstanding care from all staff
body:
I have been in the Queen Elizabeth Hospital in Glasgow now past seven weeks I was admitted to the Renal ward 4D due to a severe infection and problems with my kidney function this was my first experience of this hospital as I normally get admitted to RAH in Paisley. During my stay at the QEUH I cannot fault any aspects of my care especially two of the staff charge nurses and most of the Staff nurses who went out there way to help me in all aspects of my stay and too the nurses who went out their way to take me downstairs to the shop for much needed drinks and snacks . I also would like to thank the catering staff who always went above and beyond to cater for my needs during my stay as it was a different menu on the renal ward to the normal food menu, which needs to be looked at again with better choices than what is on the menu now as it's disgusting.  
Thank you once again for my outstanding care which the nurses should be praised for

title: WARD 13-A-A28   "lovely and very special‚Ä¶
body:
I was admitted on 27 May and was placed in ward 13 with breathing
problems, any anxiety I may have had, was soon alleviated by the 
kindness and sheer professionalism, of every member of staff, I encountered on ward 13, I was also overwhelmed by the total control
and constant attention given, by these nurses etc, to the endless stream of patients they treat. Everyone is treated in a equal and in a
unbiased  profound way, these special nurses never show there 
personal feelings and yet even with the pressures of there work, they
somehow still manage to retain there sense of humours, showing there true professionalism and always following the hospitals rules
and protocols at all time ,these really are special people.
Finally a massive thank to the nurses etc, that attended me on ward 13, I did drop 3 boxes of chocolates in for you all to share, you are special people ,who as part of a team are brilliant and as individual characters, you are incredible and lovely caring people.
Thank you.
xxx  Malcolm D Binns. xxx

author: Davies443
title: Above and beyond service
body: The 2 E.N.T guys at the royal Glamorgan hospital were very attentive, respectful and considerate with the medical problem ( suspected Quinsy) that I was referred with by the GP, and went above and beyond with their care. I am very grateful to have had the care they gave and the help I received by the one E.N.T throughout the whole visit. Their care was second to none. Many thanks guys for the care shown on Wednesday and the thoughtful follow ups after.

author: Joher34
title: Im in a better place
body: I found it hard to talk to family and friends even though I have  fantastic family and friends speaking to someone else is easier my therapist helped me deal with my anxiety and depression the hardest thing is realizing you need to talk so please get help thanks to my therapist and six degrees I'm in a better place

author: L1998
title: I'm now a happy motivated person
body: I was having trouble with alcohol and another substance. My mum researched CGL and rang them as she was getting really worried about me. CGL responded quickly and I had an appointment set up in the next week or so. I spoke to a support worker there and he asked me questions related to my current intake of the alcohol and substance. Then he gave me support by telling me about online groups which I attended. They really helped gearing others experiences with their addictions and then my key worker would give strategies of how to cope when having the cravings and distractions. With CGLs help I have now completely stopped drinking etc and I'm a happy, motivated person.

author: leobm39
title: Change of key worker
body: I had a key worker that I worked well with and unfortunately the powers that be decided that my worker wasn't going to see me anymore because I fell into the wrong category 4 or 5 months went passed and I never had contact with my new key worker. The new key worker left and now I'm back with the old key worker who said its probably temporary so I'm really happy to be back with my old key worker but see little point in getting too happy as I will probably not last.

author: Dmdxx
title: Dental Department
body:
I can honestly say I was nervous, apprehensive attending the dental practice with my daughter.  
As a parent of an Autistic Young Adult whom has a massive fear of Dentists,Germs, and experiences complete sensory overload in these kind of environments, My daughter also has many other health conditions, Life threatening Allergies,  
This was a massive event for my daughter, I was very anxious that she would not be able to go through with the appointment although I new it was critical as she had a massive cavity in a back tooth and also required having her wisdom tooth removed.  
On arriving at the clinic the place was extremely clean, the reception staff were wonderful and could see that My daughter was very nervous.  
The Dental Technician was unbelievable with My daughter, The situation as a whole was Stress free, Calm, The Dental Technician explained everything in detail, She was Calm softly spoken, This amazing lady had never met My daughter before and was able to give my daughter a few Jags, removed a wisdom tooth, without any tears or drama, My daughter left feeling great and couldn‚Äôt wait to go back and have a small filling. This experience was brilliant for my daughter and her fear of dentists has completely gone.  
Thank you so much to all the dental Staff, receptionists, Dental Technician Geraldine you don't just do an amazing job,  
But you do amazingly well,  
Thank you on behalf of Myself and My daughter x

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: MaxiP1992
title: Excellent care for my baby
body:
After numerous calls to ADOC and the GP about my daughter and her worrying symptoms, Sister Gardiner called me and agreed my daughter needed reviewed after I had contacted the GP practice concerned again.  
She was so patient, kind and reassuring with myself and my 1 year old and after 3 days of high temps, fast breathing, a decline in my babies health and concerned calls to the out of hours team, Sister Gardiner quickly diagnosed my baby with a chest infection and got her some antibiotics.  
I know this is her job and she does things like this for people every day, but she really listened to me- mum to mum, and agreed to check my daughter out again despite her already being checked the previous day by ADOC.  
My daughter was born 3 months early and due to the prematurity of her lungs at birth, a simple chest infection gone untreated any longer than we had already left it could have resulted in a trip to the hospital.  
I am incredibly thankful to you Sister Gardiner, within a day my daughter has already turned a corner and back to her usual cheeky self.

author: Sherah 21
title: Disorganisation in vaccine programme
body: My husband and I had our first covid vaccinations on the same day, similar time and at the same place. However our second appointment was in different days 14 hours apart. I did attempt to change this appointment but there were no available appointments on the same day. So having to take a car journey from Cumbernauld to East Kilbride, then again the following morning... you would think that these appointments would have been better coordinated...

author: 93potatoes
title: It feels like my struggles are dismissed
body:
I've been with mental health services for the last 15 years, and never have been treated worse than in this place. It feels like all my struggles are dismissed, the staff has repeatedly talked about referring me to talking therapy but it has not happened, and I feel I'd be better off on my own. I've been trying to get assessed for ADHD due to my suspicions and the ineffectiveness of all other treatments I've tried, but have been wrongly told by staff that adults can't have ADHD and that the NHS doesn't offer that service, which isn't correct.  
I'm really unwell, unable to work and unable to properly care for myself and my family due to my poor mental health, yet all I get from the mental health services is a half-yearly 15 minute appointment with a psychiatrist who it seems doesn't believe anything I say. Ironically they tell me there's nothing wrong with me and I'm completely normal, yet at the same time I'm still their patient and they have continued prescribing me antidepressants.  
In short, these services have only caused me more uncertainty and anxiety than before.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: plutobg48
title: I could not fault anything
body: I was in AMU Altnagevin  Hospital  and just want  to take the opportunity  to say thank you  to sister and all the staff for the care and treatment  received. I could not fault anything. Staff so busy but very attentive.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Bronaghs
title: Child birth
body:
Had a baby during the Covid Pandemic.  
I was terrified and felt so alone.  
My labour was extremely fast, 15 minutes in total!  
I was reassured throughout by the amazing staff in Antrim Area Hospital. I had my husband with me in the delivery suite only, the staff made this little time that we had, the most special holistic experience My life.  
There were no visitors allowed, this resulted in an extremely restful time on the ward. The therapeutic level of care provided was a surprise for me, I expected to be anxious and alone but it was totally the opposite. Patients had their curtains open, midwives stayed in the open bay with us, we engaged and laughed, and most importantly, we rested well. This was my second baby so I have had 2 very different experiences. I feel the second was the most beneficial for me and my baby. I was able to spend more time bonding just me and baby and more time was available to assist me with breastfeeding. I know it seems difficult not to have visitors, but I feel in hindsight, this is what is needed for the future.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
